khenrab Norbu Rev. Khenrab Norbu was born to Astrologer Ngawo Che and Yangchen in ༼m1883༽ A.D. at Tsethang, Southern Tibet. He was appointed as the director of both The Chagpori Medical College and Lhasa Tibetan Medical and Astrology Institute in ༼m1916༽ by the Great Thirteen Dalai Lama. He formulated ༼m125༽ different medicines along with their actions in a book titled " བདུད་རྩི་འབུམ་བཟང ". He dedicated his entire life in promoting Tibetan Medicine and astrology. Plasma It is the fundamental substance of the body. It contains essential nutrients from digested food and this liquid circulates throughout the body and nourishes all the tissues, organs and system. Although plasma is present throughout the body, it resides mainly in the heart, blood vessels, lymph system, skin and soft body tissues. It is one of the seven bodily constituents. [e:Plasma It is the fundamental substance of the body. Interrogation Interrogation enables the physician to make a good judgement of the disease and in getting a clear picture of the patient. The diagnosis of the disease is also based on the patient's response to the doctor's questions. Three main aspects of interrogation are the causative factors, site of the illness, and signs and symptoms. The internal Kalachakra The Internal Kalachakra ( ནང་དུས་ཀྱི་ཁོར་ལོ ), provides an understanding of the three fundamental interdependent components of our body Viz: Energy Channels ( རྩ ), Wind ( རླུང ), Essential Drops [e:The internal Kalachakra The Internal Kalachakra ( ནང་དུས་ཀྱི་ཁོར་ལོ ), provides an understanding of the three fundamental interdependent components of our body Viz: Energy Channels ( རྩ ), Wind ( རླུང ), Essential Drops ( ཐིག་ལེ ), and the effect that external forces such as planets and stars have on our body. Kalachakra Astrology explains that the energy Channels are like our home, essential drops as our property and energy wind and mind as the owner.

chee wo dechen khorlo The wheel of great bhss at the crown This wheel is called 'the wheel of great bliss', because the foundation of great bliss, the white Bodhicitta, abides mainly at the crown (Tib. ཙབངས་པའི་བུ་ག ; ༼grm=lit༽ Brahmic fissure). It is located at the crown of the head (situated in the area beneath the top of the skull and just above the brain). It is multi-coloured: white, -green, red and black and is triangular in shape. It is believed that during the moment of liberation consciousness leaves the body through this exit point to merge with the Absolute (Brahman). It corresponds to the level of ultimate reality on the one hand and to the brain on the other. In an ordinary person, this wheel is responsible for the higher mental functions, especially discernment (Buddha). In the yogin and yogini, its full potential manifests in the form of mystical experience and illumination. The central channel is constricted by two side channels [e:chee wo dechen khorlo The wheel of great bhss at the crown This wheel is called 'the wheel of great bliss', because the foundation of great bliss, the white Bodhicitta, abides mainly at the crown (Tib. ཙབངས་པའི་བུ་ག ; ༼grm=lit༽ Brahmic fissure). It is located at the crown of the head (situated in the area beneath the top of the skull and just above the brain). It is multi-coloured: white, -green, red and black and is triangular in shape. It is believed that during the moment of liberation consciousness leaves the body through this exit point to merge with the Absolute (Brahman). It corresponds to the level of ultimate reality on the one hand and to the brain on the other. In an ordinary person, this wheel is responsible for the higher mental functions, especially discernment (Buddha). In the yogin and yogini, its full potential manifests in the form of mystical experience and illumination. The central channel is constricted by two side channels ( རོ་མ and རྐྱང་མ ) making a knot. These channels branch off into four, eight and eventually into thirty two branch channels.

Brown Phlegm A disease which belongs to the category of complex བད་ཀན diseases. It arises when all three humours- རླུང། མཁྲིས་པ། བད་ཀན། ; and blood and serum are disturbed and become intermingled. It has two major types, which may be hot or cold. 1. Hot བད་ཀན་སྨུག་པོ ( བད་ཀན་སྨུག་པོ་ཇས་བབས ); a disease characterised by proliferation of impure blood that generates in the liver and small intestine 2. Cold བད་ཀན་སྨུག་པོ ( བད་ཀན་སྨུག་པོ་མས་ཆགས ); a disease characterised by weakening the power of digestive མཁྲིས་པ and the fire like རླུང in the stomach and disrupts the digestive process བད་ཀན་རྩ Pulse indicating phelgm The qualities of phlegmic pulse is sunken, weak and slow [e:Brown Phlegm A disease which belongs to the category of complex བད་ཀན diseases. Madhyamapritipad 1. Centre; It refers to a central energy channel which is located midway between the left and right channels. It extends from the tip of the sex organs up to the top of the head from where it bends down in an arch and ends between the eyebrows. The essestial drops pass through this energy channel. 2. , meaning the 'middle way' between the extremes of eternalism and nihilism. Within the contexts of the Madhyamaka school, 'middle way' refers to the philosophy of emptiness, which is held to be the true nature of all things. According to this view all phenomena cannot be found to possess any independent and self-validating natures. [e:1. Fire-like wind location: Stomach Pathways: Through stomach and small intestines to all the alimentary canals and the internal organs. Functions: Digests the food, separation of essence and wastes of food and drinks, transports the nutrients to various tissue elements and discharges wastes into colon, helps in the assimilation and maturation of nutrients extracted from food and drinks and governs the movements within the digestive channels, ripens the ten objects of harm (the seven bodily sustainers and the three excretions). Negative Actions: Disturbing the balance of this air can result in loss of appetite, mucus accumulation in the stomach, indigestion, loss of weight, poor assimilation, liver weakness, gastric trouble, constipation and diarrhea.

It is also used against tuberculosis, infectious venereal disease, typhoid fever, cough, diabetes, chest and lung problems, rheumatism, influenza, inflammed joints, skin disease, kidney and gallstones, liver problems, intermittent fever, asthama, nausea, constipation, insect ites, tumours, boils with pus, ulcers, nasal bleeding and arthritis. Channels This term refers to the nerves, veins and arteries. There are three types of major channels or རྩ . ༼m1༽ The white one ( རྩ་དཀར ) is related to the nerves and leads to the brain ༼m2༽ The black one ( རྩ་ནག ) refers to the veins and leads to the liver and the gall bladder [e:Channels This term refers to the nerves, veins and arteries. There are three types of major channels or རྩ .   ༼m1༽ The white one ( རྩ་དཀར ) is related to the nerves and leads to the brain   ༼m2༽ The black one ( རྩ་ནག ) refers to the veins and leads to the liver and the gall bladder   ༼m3༽ The red one ( རྩ་དམར ) refers to the arteries and leads to the heart.

The central energy channel The central energy channel stands midway between the left and right channels and extends from the tip of the sex organ up to the top of the head from where it bends down in an arch and terminates between the eyebrows. These form at the heart, while the fetus is still in the womb. The essential drops [e:The central energy channel The central energy channel stands midway between the left and right channels and extends from the tip of the sex organ up to the top of the head from where it bends down in an arch and terminates between the eyebrows. These form at the heart, while the fetus is still in the womb. The essential drops ( ཐིག་ལེ ) pass through this energy channel. The sushumna nadi, located within the spinal cord, begins at the pelvic plexus and ends in the cerebro-spinal axis between the two hemispheres of the brain. The seven chakras are located along the sushumna nadi from the top of the head to the base of the spine

Channels, Wind and Drops These are not only the principle life supporting substances of human body, but also the key means to attain enlightenment. The knowledge of རྩ། རླུང། and ཐིག་ལེ is a must for us to keep our mind, body and spirit in sound health as well as to understand our true nature. The Mother Tantra (མ་རྒྱུད) uses the metaphor of a wild horse for the vital breath and the rider for the mind. The wild horse is blind so it needs a guide, and the rider is lame so he/she needs help to be carried. They need each other in order to flow together through the paths of subtle channels ( རྩ ). The Internal Kalachakra [e:Channels, Wind and Drops These are not only the principle life supporting substances of human body, but also the key means to attain enlightenment. The knowledge of རྩ། རླུང། and ཐིག་ལེ is a must for us to keep our mind, body and spirit in sound health as well as to understand our true nature. The Mother Tantra (མ་རྒྱུད) uses the metaphor of a wild horse for the vital breath and the rider for the mind. The wild horse is blind so it needs a guide, and the rider is lame so he/she needs help to be carried. They need each other in order to flow together through the paths of subtle channels ( རྩ ). The Internal Kalachakra ( ནང་དུས་ཀྱི་ཁོར་ལོ ) uses the metaphor of a house for the channels, essential drops as the property and vital breath and mind as the owner. Therefore, these three fundamental interdependent components of our body can be utilized through proper Tibetan Yantra Yoga འཁྲུལ་ཁོར ), the 'Magical Wheel' practice to understand the ultimate nature of all phenomena. From this it is very clear that these three principle components of our body are the very basis of our consciousness to sustain and survival of our lives.

The sixteen realms of forms The four realms of wind are located at four around the forehead of Mount Meru: ༼m1༽ འོག་མིན (unsurpassed) ༼m2༽ ཤིན་ཏུ་མཐོང (good vision) ༼m3༽ མི་གདུང (without distress) ༼m4༽ མི་ཆེ་བ་ (not greater) The four realms of fire are situated at four parts around nose of Mount Meru: ༼m1༽ འབྲས་བུ་ཆེ (great result) ༼m2༽ བོད་ནམས་སྐྱེས (merit born) ༼m3༽ སྤྲིན་མེད (cloudless) ༼m4༽ དགེ་རྒྱས (flourishing virtue) The four realms of water are located at chin area: ༼m1༽ ཙབད་མེད་དགེ (limitless virtue) ༼m2༽ དགེ་ཆུང (lesser virtue) ༼m3༽ འོད་གསལ་བ (clear light) ༼m4༽ ཚད་མེད་འོད (measureless light) The four realms of earth are located at two thirds of the neck of Mount Meru: ༼m1༽ འོད་ཆུང (lesser light) ༼m2༽ ཚངས་ཆེན (great pure ones) ༼m3༽ མདུན་ན་དོན (chanting in the presence of Brahma) [e:The sixteen realms of forms The four realms of wind are located at four around the forehead of Mount Meru:   ༼m1༽ འོག་མིན (unsurpassed)   ༼m2༽ ཤིན་ཏུ་མཐོང (good vision)   ༼m3༽ མི་གདུང (without distress)   ༼m4༽ མི་ཆེ་བ་ (not greater) The four realms of fire are situated at four parts around nose of Mount Meru:   ༼m1༽ འབྲས་བུ་ཆེ (great result)   ༼m2༽ བོད་ནམས་སྐྱེས (merit born)   ༼m3༽ སྤྲིན་མེད (cloudless)   ༼m4༽ དགེ་རྒྱས (flourishing virtue) The four realms of water are located at chin area:   ༼m1༽ ཙབད་མེད་དགེ (limitless virtue)   ༼m2༽ དགེ་ཆུང (lesser virtue)   ༼m3༽ འོད་གསལ་བ (clear light)   ༼m4༽ ཚད་མེད་འོད (measureless light) The four realms of earth are located at two thirds of the neck of Mount Meru:   ༼m1༽ འོད་ཆུང (lesser light)   ༼m2༽ ཚངས་ཆེན (great pure ones)   ༼m3༽ མདུན་ན་དོན (chanting in the presence of Brahma)   ༼m4༽ ཚང་རིས (group of the pure ones)

Distant causes (the fundamental ignorance which gives rise to all cyclical existence) According to རྒུད་བཞི། the sole cause of all the diseases is said to be ignorance or lack of understanding of the meaning of selflessness [e:Distant causes (the fundamental ignorance which gives rise to all cyclical existence) According to རྒུད་བཞི། the sole cause of all the diseases is said to be ignorance or lack of understanding of the meaning of selflessness ( བདག་མེད ). rgyud.bzhi emphasises this by drawing an example of a flying bird which can't cut off from its shadow; similarly, all living beings may have momentary peace and happiness, but is impossible for them to be free of sickness, because of their ignorance. Hence, in the 8th chapter of the Explanatory Tantra 'ignorance' is categorised under distant causes.

vayu, vata Wind, རླུང is a vital principle in our body, that is responsible for both the proper functioning of mind and body. It helps imunize against breast cancer, heals tissues by encouraging cells to proliferate. It is an antibiotic food and possesses antibacterial powers, acts as anti-inflamatory, anti-rheumatic and liver decongestant. Fresh cabbage juice is very valuable in both gastric and duodenal ulcers. The juice is also beneficial in infectious diseases like obstruction jaundice and bladder infection. Externally the leave of cabbages can be used on wounds, inflammations, arthritic joints, ulcers and skin conditions like acne. In folk medicines, it is taken internally for ailments like digestive and lung disorders, migraines, fluid retention and aches and pains. Recent clinical trials have demonstrated their effectiveness in treating stomach ulcers and obesity. ལོ་འགོ The beginning of the year ལོ་རྒན་དྲུག་ཅུ Sixty-year cycle ལོ་བརྒྱད་དྲི་ཆུ Urine of an eight year old (child)

This drop of awakening is called 'the body-drop' [e:A preliminary therapeutic test སད་པའི་སྐབས་ཀཡཟ་ཐིག་ལེ The drop of awakening It abides mainly at the forehead and the navel; and refers to a state, when energies in the upper portion of the body converge at the forehead and energies in the lower portion of the body converge at the navel, at the time of one's awakening from sleep. It is also used to relieve indigestion, promote sweating, and to tonify the nervous system. It is good for throat problems, such as tonsillitis, laryngitis, and hoarseness. Recent research suggests that cayenne can ease severe pain of shingles and migraines. But excessive consumption of cayenne can lead to gastro enteritis and liver damage. It is advised to avoid seeds, as they can be toxic.

Impure blood It is produced in the liver under pathological conditions. It is the result of imbalance fire-like རླུང in the stomach, which fails to separate essence and the waste matter. Thus, a mixture of essence and waste matter flows in to the liver, where impure blood is produced. This impure blood when leaving the liver enters the circulatory system. The presence of impure blood in the body is characterised by dark lips, dark skin, dark face, pimples and the whites of the eyes turn reddish brown. [e:Impure blood It is produced in the liver under pathological conditions. It is the result of imbalance fire-like རླུང in the stomach, which fails to separate essence and the waste matter. Thus, a mixture of essence and waste matter flows in to the liver, where impure blood is produced. This impure blood when leaving the liver enters the circulatory system. The presence of impure blood in the body is characterised by dark lips, dark skin, dark face, pimples and the whites of the eyes turn reddish brown.

Illness astrology/Medical astrology Medical Astrology is prepared in many ways according to reliable ancient sources. The Eight Goddess Calculation Scripture ( ལྷ་མོ་བརྒྱད་རྩིས ), Seven Week days Divination scripture [e:Illness astrology/Medical astrology Medical Astrology is prepared in many ways according to reliable ancient sources. The Eight Goddess Calculation Scripture ( ལྷ་མོ་བརྒྱད་རྩིས ), Seven Week days Divination scripture ( གཟའ་བདུན་མོ་དཔེ ) and many other means. It is mainly prepared and drawn for patients who had prolonged medication and less improvement in their health. The Medical astrologer gives antidotes, rituals and guidance as per the astrological calculation and divination. By astrological calculation, the astrologer shows which physician to consult and also identify the harmful spirits.

Avalambaka-kapha Supportive Phlegm, Location: Thoracic and stomach Function: Regulates the bodily fluids, maintains moisture level of the body, supports and nourishes remaining four types of བད་ཀན and liquifies foods. Negative Actions: When this བད་ཀན is out of balance, it causes loss of appetite, vomiting of sour fluid, gastritis [e:Supportive Phlegm, ༼sk= Avalambaka-kapha༽ Location: Thoracic and stomach Function: Regulates the bodily fluids, maintains moisture level of the body, supports and nourishes remaining four types of བད་ཀན and liquifies foods. Negative Actions: When this བད་ཀན is out of balance, it causes loss of appetite, vomiting of sour fluid, gastritis (inflammation of the stomach) and ulcers in small intestine, impairment of digestive process, heaviness of the abdomen and nausea.

slesaka-kapha Connective Phlegm, Location: Joints Function: It connects various bodily joints, lubricates and gives them their solidity, protects the joints from external factors like heat, gives ease and flexibility of movement and enhances stretching and retraction power of the limbs. Negative Actions: When this Bad-kan is out of balance, it causes swollen and painful joints, difficulty in stretching and retracting the limbs, and weakness of the joints. [e:Connective Phlegm, ༼sk= slesaka-kapha༽ Location: Joints Function: It connects various bodily joints, lubricates and gives them their solidity, protects the joints from external factors like heat, gives ease and flexibility of movement and enhances stretching and retraction power of the limbs. Negative Actions: When this Bad-kan is out of balance, it causes swollen and painful joints, difficulty in stretching and retracting the limbs, and weakness of the joints.

kledaka-kapha Decomposing Phlegm, Location: Epigastric region [e:Decomposing Phlegm, ༼sk= kledaka-kapha༽ Location: Epigastric region (upper region of the stomach) Function: Breaking down of solid food into semi-liquid state, mixing the decomposed food for proper digestion. Negative Actions: When this Bad-kan is out of balance, it causes poor digestion; frequent belching, vomiting, laziness and lethargy.

bodhaka-kapha Experiencing Phlegm, Location: Tongue Function: Sends water to the tongue and palate, gives perception of tastes and registers each of the six tastes and sends respective impulses. Negative Actions: When this བད་ཀན is out of balance, it causes lose of the sense of taste, lack of thirst, anorexia, obesity, cold feeling in the tongue and roughness of the voice [e:Experiencing Phlegm, ༼sk= bodhaka-kapha༽ Location: Tongue Function: Sends water to the tongue and palate, gives perception of tastes and registers each of the six tastes and sends respective impulses. Negative Actions: When this བད་ཀན is out of balance, it causes lose of the sense of taste, lack of thirst, anorexia, obesity, cold feeling in the tongue and roughness of the voice

tarpaka-kapha Satisfying Phlegm, Location: Head Function: It is responsible for bringing satisfaction to five senses by increasing the power of five senses to perceive their various objects better. Negative Actions: When this བད་ཀན is out of balance, it causes impairment of sense organs, loss of memory, dullness of sensory perceptions, visual distortion, heaviness of the head, and problems in nervous system. Jangpa Namgyal Daksang He was a famous 14th century Tibetan Scholar. He was born in Tsang and became proficient in all the major sciences. He authored many books on Tibetan medicine including Essence of the Eight Branches; Clear Light Explanation of the Root Tantra; River of Nectar: The Explanation of Oral Tantra and Wishfulfilling Explanation of the Last Tantra. He passed away at the age of 81. [e:Jangpa Namgyal Daksang He was a famous 14th century Tibetan Scholar. He was born in Tsang and became proficient in all the major sciences. Eight kinds of lymph node disorders ༼m1༽ རླུང་རྨེན -a disorder, which is related to རླུང་and it is characterised by a large sack-like protuberance. ༼m2༽ མཁྲིས་རྨེན -a disorder connected to མཁྲིས་པ and it is characterised by burning sensation in the affected lymph nodes accompanied by pain and leads to swollen nodes which are red to yellow in colour. ༼m3༽ བད་ཀན་རྨེན་བུ -a disease which is influenced by བད་ཀན and it is characterised by pale lymph node, hard swelling, and cold feeling in the affected lymph node. ༼m4༽ ཁྲག་རྨེན -a disease connected with blood and affects the vessels and it is characterised by high fever, swelling and affected part turn red and warm. ༼m5༽ སྦ་རྨེན -a disorder related to the muscle tissue and it is characterised by hard, large and greasy swollen swollen nodes, and protruding blood vessels. ༼m6༽ ཚིལ་རྨེན -a. disorder affects fatty tissue and it is characterised by white swollen nodes and cold sensation at the affected area. ༼m7༽ རྩ་རྨེན -a disorder which are related to the arteries and veins and it is characterised by painful lymph nodes which move around when touched. ༼m7༽ རྟིང་པ་ཡངས་པ -his heels are soft ༼m8༽ སྐུ་ཆེ་ཞིང་དྲང་བ -he is tall and straight ༼m9༽ ཞབས་ཀྱི་ལོང་བུ་མི་མངོན་པ -his ankle-bones do not protrude ༼m10༽ སྐུའི་སྤུ་གྱེན་དུ་ཕྱོགས་པ -the hairs on his Pacific Eleven [e:Pacific Eleven Ingredients: མ་ནུ། སྒ་སྐྱ། ཨ་རུ། ལྕུམ་རྩ། ཅོང་ཞི་ཚ་བཏུལ། བུལ་ཏོག། སྟར་བུ། སྦྲུལ་ཤ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། རྒྱ་ཚ། སྡིག་སྲིན། འོལ་མོ་སེ Nature: Neutral Uses: A compound which treats indigestion, difficult child birth, obstructed menstruation, abdominal distension, and other disorders associated with menstruation.

Drop of the fourth occasion It abides at the crown of the head and at the genitals. It refers to a state of sexual bliss experienced during sexual intercourse between a man and a woman. During this time, energies in the upper portion of the body converge at the crown and the energies in the lower portion of the body converge at the genitals. Bliss is experienced with the descent of the bodhicitta drops. This drop of the fourth occasion is also called 'the 'drop of transcendental wisdom' [e:Drop of the fourth occasion It abides at the crown of the head and at the genitals. It refers to a state of sexual bliss experienced during sexual intercourse between a man and a woman. During this time, energies in the upper portion of the body converge at the crown and the energies in the lower portion of the body converge at the genitals. Bliss is experienced with the descent of the bodhicitta drops. This drop of the fourth occasion is also called 'the 'drop of transcendental wisdom' (Tib. ཡེ་ཤེས་ཀྱི་ཐིག་ལེ ).

The Great Cold Compound Precious Black Pill This precious pill was formulated by Nagarjuna ( མགོན་པོ་ཀླུ་སྒྲུབ ) and introduced in Tibet by ཨཱོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ [e:The Great Cold Compound Precious Black Pill This precious pill was formulated by Nagarjuna ( མགོན་པོ་ཀླུ་སྒྲུབ ) and introduced in Tibet by ཨཱོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ (1229-1309). Ingredients: གསེར་ཐལ། བཙོ་ཐལ། ལྷན་ཚེར་བཏུལ་མ། དངུལ་ཐལ། ཏྭངས། ཐལ། ལྕགས་ཐལ། རག་ཐལ། མཁར་ཐལ། ཞན་ཐལ། བཤའ་ཐལ། ཁམས་བརྒྱད། ལྕགས་རྩི་ཟླ་འོད། སྦུར་ལེན་ལས་སྣོན། བྱི་རུ་ལས་སྣོན། ཁྱུང། སྐྱུགས་ལས་སྣོན། དུང་ལས་སྣོན། ནལ་ལས་སྣོན། མུ་མེན་ལས་སྣོན། གྱུ་ལས་སྣོན། མན་ཤེའི་ལས་སྣོན། པྲིང་ཀུ། ཕ་ལམ་ལས་སྣོན། མརྒད་ལས་སྣོན། ཨིན་ད་ནི་ལ་ལས་སྣོན། ཤུག་ཚེར་པད་རག་ལས་སྣོན། ག་བུར། ཆུ་དངས་ནོར་བུ་ལས་སྣོན། སྤུག་ལས་སྣོན། མུ་ཏིག་ལས་སྣོན། མདུང་རྩེ་དཀར་པོ་ལས་སྣོན། ཉ་ཕྱིས་ལས་སྣོན། རྒྱ་རུ། གངས། ཐིགས་ཆུ་བཅད། མ་ནུ། མཚལ་བཏུལ་མ། གི་ཝམ། ལི་ཤི་ལྕགས་རྡོ་ལས་སྣོན། ཡོ་འབོག་སྙ་ལོའི་རྩ་བ་བོང་སེར། དཔའ་དཀར། བོང་དཀར། དཔའ་སེར། མན་རྫི་ར་ལས་སྣོན། གླ་རྩི། ཁ་ཤའི་ར། ཨར་ནག་ལེགས་པ། མདུང་རྩེ་དམར་པོ་ལས་སྣོན། ཛ་ཏི། ཁབ་ལེན་ལས་སྣོན། གྲི་མཆིན། བསེ་ཡབ། དཔའ་རྒོ་ད། ཅོང་ཞི་རིགས་ལྔ་ཚ་བཏུལ། ཚ་ལ་ཆུ་བཅད། མགྲོན་ཐལ། ཙན་དཀར། སུག་སྨེལ། གུར་གུམ། ཀོ་ཇི་བཏུལ་མ། བོང་དམར། ཡུ་གུ་ཤིང་ཁནཏ། སུ་མི་དཀར་པ། སུ་མི་སེར་པོ། སྨུག་ཅུ་གང། གང་ཆུང། རེ་རལ་ཁན་ཏ། བྱ་རྒོད་སྤོས། བྲག་སྐྱ། ཧོ། སྤྱི་ཞུར། བྱི་འུ་ལ་ཕུག། སྟག་ཤ་ནག་པོ། ཟི་ར་ནག་པོ། སོ་ར། སྤང། རྒྱན་དཀར་པོ། ཀྱི་ལྕེ་དཀར་པོ། ཨ་བཧི་ཁ། ལུང་ཐང་མིག། སེར་པོ་གུ་དྲུས། བསེ་རུ་དཀར་པོ། སྒ་དམར། བ་རུ། རྨ་བྱིའི་མདོང་ཐིག། བྲག་ཞུན། སྒང་ཐུར་ལས་སྣོན། སྲ་འབྲས། སྐྱེར། ཤུན། བུ་མོ་སྟག། ལོ་པའི་ཤ་བའི་ཚིལ་ལས་སྣོན། སེང་གེའི་ཚིལ་ལས་སྣོན། སྟག་གི་འོ་མ། དཔལ་གང། སེ་རྒོད་བར་ཤུན། དབང་ལག། འོམ་བུ་བར་ཤུན། སྲད་ནག་དུས་བཏུས། ལྕགས་སྦྲུལ། ཨ་རུ། ཁྱུང་སྡེར་སྨུག་པོ། ཁྱུང་སྡེར་དཀར་པོ། སྤུ་ཤེལ། རིསེ། པར་པ་ཏ། ཨུུཏ་པལ། སྤང་རྩི། སྒོང་ཐོག། རྩི་དམར། ལྕག་ཀྱུ་བ། གསེར་མེ། རྒྱ་ཏིག། སུམ་ཏིག། སྟོང་ཟིལ། ཏང་ཀུན། ད་ལི། འུ་སུ། གུལ་ནག། ཛི་ར་དཀར་པོ། ལ་ལ་ཕུད། དུག་ཉུང། སླེ་ཏྲེས། བཙོད་ཁྲག། ཕག་ཁྲག། ཨ་འབྲས། འཇམ་འབྲས། སྟར་བུ་ཁན་ཏ། སྤོས་དཀར། ཐལ་རྡོར། པི་པི་ལིང། ཕོ་རིལ། སྨྱག། རུ་རྟ། སྐྱུ་རུ། སྟག་གི་མཆེ་བ་བསྲེག་ཐལ། ལུག་རུ་སྨུག་པོ། ཉ་རུས་བསྲེག་ཐལ། རྨ་བྱའི་མཁྲིས་པ། Nature: Slightly cool Uses: It is beneficial in the treatment of བད་ཀན་སྨུག་པོ། debility, three stages of dropsy, chronic fever, contagious fever, allergies, gastroenteritis, infectious diseases, internal suppuration and abscess, serous fluid disease, blood diseases, nerve ailments, arthritis, liver disease, poor complexion, strengthen the major organ system and bony structure, remedy for chemical poison, food poison, poisonous bites, environmental pollution and is a general health tonic.

The Great Precious Purified Moon Crystal This preparation was formulated by Nagarjuna ( མགོན་པོ་ཀླུ་སྒྲུབ ) and introduced in Tibet by ཨཱོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ [e:The Great Precious Purified Moon Crystal This preparation was formulated by Nagarjuna ( མགོན་པོ་ཀླུ་སྒྲུབ ) and introduced in Tibet by ཨཱོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ (1229-1309) and ཟུར་མཁར་པ . The Precious Wish fulfilling Jewel This preparation is based on the formula by ཨོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ [e:The Precious Wish fulfilling Jewel This preparation is based on the formula by ཨོ་རྒྱན་པ་རིནཆེན་དཔལ (1229-1309) and it consists of about seventy ingredients. Ingredients: ལྷང་ཐལ། བཅུ་གང། མུ་ཏིག་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། ཛི་ནག། བྱུ་རུ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། བ་རུ། བཙོ་ཐལ། གསེར་ཐལ། དངུལ་ཐལ། ཡངས་ཐལ། ལྕགས་ཐལ། ཞ་ཐལ། གཤའ་ཐལ། རག་ཐལ། འཁར་ཐལ། ཙན་དམར། ཏི་ཐལ། ཁམས་བདུན་ཐལ་བ། སྨུག། ཅུ་གང་ལེགས་པ། གུར་གུམ། ལི་ཤི། ཛ་ཏི། སུག་སྨེལ། ཀ་ཀོ་ལ། ཛི་དཀར། ཤིང་ཚ། པི་པི་ལིང། ཨ་རུ། སྐྱུ་རུ། ཨར་ནག་ལེགས་པ། ཙན་དཀར། ཤིང་མངར། སྤོས་དཀར། སོ་མ་ར་ཟ། སྒ་སྐྱ། སྡིག་སྲིན། རྒྱ་ཚ། རི་སྙིང། གུལ་ནག། གཟི་དཀར་ཕྲ་མེན་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། གཟི་དམར་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། གཟི་སྨུག་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། གཟི་ཁྲ་བོ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། གྱུ་ལེགས་པ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། མཏཧསོང་དམར་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། མ་ནི་ཧོ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། སྡིག་ནག་དུག་ཕྲལ། ཉ་ཕྱིས། ཐལ་རྡོར། གཧི་ཝརན། ས་འཛིན། གྱང་ཏྲི་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། མར་གད་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། ཤ་སྐམ། གཟའ་བདུད་དཀར་པོ། མུ་མེན་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། ཞུ་མིག་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། ནལ་ལས་སྣོན་བྱས་པ། གླ་རྩི་གཟའ་བདུད་ནག་པོ། ལྕམའབྲུ། ཀླུ་བདུད་རྡོ་རྗེ། ཏེ་ལོའི་ཤ། འབྲོང་གི་སྙིང་ཁྲག། བསེ་རུ་བཏུལ་མ། Nature: Neutral Uses: It is beneficial in the treatment of apoplexy, depression,epilepsy, loss consciousness, dermatological diseases, neurological disorders, paralysis, swelling of the extremities due to bad blood circulation, acute pain, involuntary defecation and urination, difficulty in closing and opening of eyelids and lips, impaired sense organs, hypertension, cardiac disease, chronic pulmonary disease, internal and external abscesses, numbness, parkinson's disease, contraction and stiffness of the limbs, insanity, fainting and impaired hearing.

Punic Sun Comfort [e:Punic Sun Comfort Ingredients: སེ་འབྲུ། ཤིང་ཚ། སུག་སྨེལ། པི་པི་ལིང། གུར་གུམ། ལྕམ་པ Nature: Warm Uses: It treats debility, promotes digestive heat, clears blockage of vessels due to formation of excess mucus and is diuretic.

Maintainer of Essence [e:Maintainer of Essence Ingredients: སེ་འབྲུ། ཤིང་ཚ། སུག་སྨེལ། པི་པི་ལིང། གུར་གུམ Nature: Warm Uses: A compound which promotes digestive heat, clears the blockage of vessels, heals debility and helps the growing children.

Punica Lotus Pedal [e:Punica Lotus Pedal Ingredients: སེ་འབྲུ། ཤིང་ཚ། སུག་སྨེལ། པི་ལིང། གར་ནག། གསེར་མེ། གསེར་མདོག། སེ་བའི་མེ་ཏོག Nature: Warm Uses: A compound used against dyspepsia, བད་ཀན disorders, gastritis and specially for བད་ཀན associated with མཁྲིས་པ disorders.

Acacua Catechu Twenty Five [e:Acacua Catechu Twenty Five Ingredients: སེང་ལྡེང། སྐྱུ་རུ། ལྕ་བ། ར་ཉེ། གྱེ་མ། བ་སྤུ། ཉེ་ཤིང། སྤོས་དཀར། ཐལ་རྡོར། སོ་ར། ཟི་དཀར། ཟི་ནག། ཏིལ་དཀར། སླེ་ཏྲེས། བ་རུ། ཨ་རུ། ཏིལ་ནག། སྐྱེར་ཤུན། སྨན་ཆེན། རུ་རྟ། གླ་རྩི། ཤུ་དག། ནག་པོ། པི་པི་ལིང། ཉ་ཕྱིས་བཏུལ་མ། དངུལ་ཆུ་དཀར་བཏུལ། Nature: Cool Uses: A compound which cures paralysis, rigidity of the limbs, neuritis, rheumatoid arthritis, fits, རྐང་འབམ and formation of excess serous fluid.

Acacia Catechu Twenty three [e:Acacia Catechu Twenty three Ingredients: སེང་ལྡེང། ཨ་རུ། བ་རུ། སྐྱུ་རུ། སྐྱེར་ཤུན། གུལ་ནག། སྤོས་དཀར། གླ་རྩི། ཧོང་ལེན། སོ་ར། ཀྱི་ལྕེ་དཀརཔོ། ཙན་དཀར། ཙན་དམར། བ་ལེ་ཀ། བ་ཤ་ཀ། གུར་གུམ། ཅུ་གང། ཟིར་དཀར། ཡཇར་ནག། གི་ཝམ། ཐལ་རྡོར། བྲག་སྤོས Nature: Cool Uses: A compound used against gout, arthritis, pain in kidneys and waist region, leucorrhea and spermatorrhoea.

Eagle Wood Eight [e:Eagle Wood Eight Ingredients: ཨ་གར། ཛ་ཏི། ཤིང་ཀུན། ཁ་རུ་ཚ། རུ་རྟ། ཨ་རུ། སྙིང་ཡཧོ། བྲག་ཞུན Nature: Warm Uses: A compound which treats palpitation of heart, unhappiness, trembling of the body, fulling up of the upper back, insanity, insomnia, dizziness, ringing sound in the ears, pain in the liver and breast, cardie pain and རླུང disorders associated with heart.

Eagle Wood Seventeen [e:Eagle Wood Seventeen Ingredients: ཨར་ནག། ཨ་རུ། བ་རུ། སྐྱུ་རུ། སྙིང་ཞོ། མཁལ་ཞོ། སླེ་ཏྲེས། གཟེར་འཇོམས། ཚེར་སྔོན། རུ་རྟ། ལི་ཤི། ཛ་ཏི། ལ་ལ་ཕུད། གུལ་ནག། སྨན་ཆེན། རི་སྙིང། བུ་རམ Nature: Neutral Uses: A compound which treats difficulty in breathing due to blood and རླུང disturbances, stiffness of neck and throat resulting from kidney fever spreading to the upper body, headache, heart disorders affecting the stability of mind, blood and རླུང disorders and pain in the waist and kidney.

Eagle Wood Fifteen [e:Eagle Wood Fifteen Ingredients: ཨ་གར། སྙིང་ཟོ། ཙན་དཀར། ཙན་དམར། ཛ་ཏི། སྲོ་ལོ་དཀར་པོ། ཅུ་གང། གུར་གུམ། མ་ནུ། ཀན་ཏ་ཀ་རི། སླེ་ཏྲེས། སྒ་སྐྱ། ཨ་རུ། བ་རུ། སྐྱུ་རུ Nature: Slightly cool Uses: It treats simultaneous pain in the upper back and front due to blood and རླུང disorders and coughing.
